case_title: ZAHOOR AHMED AND 2 OTHERS vs MEMBER, BOARD OF REVENUE, BALUCHISTAN AND 3 OTHERS
respondents: Member, Board of Revenue, Baluchistan and 3 others

key_points.petitioners_relationship: Petitioners Nos. 1 and 2 are brothers, petitioner No. 3 is their sister's son.
key_points.related_case: Mst. Perveen Akhtar filed a suit for dissolution of marriage in Rawalpindi.
key_points.allegation: Petitioners allegedly cheated respondent No. 4 of Rs. 3,000 under false representation.
key_points.initial_action: Assistant Commissioner dismissed the complaint as a civil dispute but later registered a criminal case under sections 420/409/109 PPC.
key_points.legal_issue: Assistant Commissioner lacked the power of review under the Criminal Law (Special Provisions) Ordinance, 1968.
key_points.court_ruling: The impugned order was beyond jurisdiction and therefore quashed.

legal_references: Raunag Ali v. Chief Settlement Commissioner and others
Haji Ali Buz Khan and another v. The Chief Land Commissioner, West Pakistan and another
costs: Each party to bear their own costs
